page.title: 10INFANTS AT GT. WAKERING SCH.
page.content: THE YOUNGEST CHILDREN AT OUR SCHOOL ARE THE FIVE YEAR OLDS IN THE RECEPTION CLASSES. THIS TERM THEY HAVE BEEN STUDYING WATER. HERE IS WHAT BETH HAS WRITTEN ABOUT WATER, "WE USE WATER AT HOME FOR WASHING THE CAR AND HAVING A BATH AND WASHING THE DOG AND WASHING THE CAT." THE OLDER INFANTS, SIX AND SEVEN YEARS OLD, HAVE BEEN FINDING OUT ABOUT HOMES AND FAMILIES AND HAYLEY HAS WRITTEN, "I AM 7 YEARS OLD AND I LIVE IN GREAT WAKERING, ESSEX. I HAVE FAIR HAIR AND BLUE EYES. MY BEST FRIENDS ARE EMMA AND DIANA. I LIVE IN A SEMI-DETACHED HOUSE AND I HAVE TWO SECRET HIDING PLACES. I HAVE A BOOK CASE AND A TOY CUPBOARD. I HAVE ONE PET AND HE MAKES A LOT OF MESS AND HE IS A HAMSTER AND HIS NAME IS HENRY." AT SEVEN YEARS OLD THE CHILDREN MOVE TO JUNIOR CLASSES.
